value.title: How Samsung is using AI software to up the camera game on its smartphones
value.excerpt: Samsung has applied approximately 60 AI models for the functions of the cameras on the Galaxy S22 Ultra, which a company executive says allows it to take detailed photos of closeups, night scenes and even match the quality of a DSLR camera.

value.title: Quadric nabs $21M to accelerate production of its AI edge chips
value.excerpt: Quadric, a startup developing chips for AI workloads at the edge, has raised $21 million in a venture funding round.

value.title: Chipotle Is Testing An AI-Driven Robot To Make Its Tortilla Chips
value.excerpt: Miso Robotics' Chippy is in test at the Chipotle Cultivate Center with plans to eventually integrate into a Chipotle restaurant in Southern California later this year.

value.title: AI Chip Startups Pull In Funding as They Navigate Supply Constraints
value.excerpt: Investors are funneling billions of dollars into startups that make chips designed for artificial-intelligence applications, which have largely avoided the supply-chain constraints and backlogs faced by larger chip makers.

value.title: Kneron AI chips adpoted by Toyota supplier Kenwood
value.excerpt: Kneron, the San Diego-based full-stack edge AI company, announced last week that its two AI chips M5S and KL520 are used by Japanese auto supplier Kenwood in its latest dashboard camera DRV-EMN5700.

value.title: Brain-based computing chips not just for AI anymore
value.excerpt: With the insertion of a little math, researchers have shown that neuromorphic computers, which synthetically replicate the brain's logic, can solve more complex problems than those posed by artificial intelligence and may even earn a place in high-performance computing.

value.title: AI core software 'Deep Learning Compiler' developed
value.excerpt: A Korean research team has unveiled a core technology which reduces the time and cost invested in developing artificial intelligence (AI) chips in small and medium-sized enterprises and startups. value.title: Digital radar on a chip speeds autonomous vehicle adoption
value.excerpt: A new radar-on-a-chip is on the way this year, capable of mass production and 4D digital imaging, heralding a new chapter for autonomous vehicles and next-gen advanced driver assistance systems (ADAS).

value.title: GPU Market Size 2022| Growth, Status and Forecast by 2024

value.title: Could AI-Powered Silicon Remastering Be A Solution To The Chip Shortage?
value.excerpt: There’s an excellent opportunity for a solution to at least some of our current chip shortage issues. And it may lie in the idea of making something old new again.

value.title: Qualcomm unveils new AI-powered 5G networking chip for mobile devices
